definitions: (of a motor or other mechanical device) begin operating, especially when triggered automatically by an electrical signal

examples.text: seconds later the emergency generators cut in

definitions: interrupt someone while they are speaking
shortDefinitions: interrupt someone while they are speaking

definitions: pull in too closely in front of another vehicle after having overtaken it

examples.text: she cut in on a station wagon, forcing the driver to brake

shortDefinitions: pull in too closely in front of another vehicle

definitions: include someone in a deal and give them a share of the profits

examples.text: it annoyed the hell out of him that she hadn't cut him in

shortDefinitions: include someone in deal and give them share of profits

definitions: interrupt a dancing couple to take over from one partner

examples.text: Saturday night she goes to an informal dance where men are rare and any girl may cut in

shortDefinitions: interrupt dancing couple to take over from one partner
